website_summaries.verdict: Highly adjustable laptop stand that folds down for travel and will work for multiple uses.
pros: Design supports even large laptops, yet the stand itself doesn't weigh much, giving it nice portability
Open design ensures you'll have plenty of airflow around the laptop
Legs can be moved in any configuration
cons: May take a lot of time to adjust the legs properly to meet your needs

customer_reviews.title: This thing is brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant design and solves several real problems. I bought it to use in bed. Sure, you can prop your laptop up on your legs but the distance from your arms and head is not ideal. This thing is extremely configurable. See photo for how to use in bed and that's only one possible bed-use configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lucido

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: For one thing, I thought the legs would be aluminum as well, but they are cheap plastic. Two, the legs are very difficult to adjust in such a way as to get both sides even, and they are impossible to adjust with the laptop on the flat surface. Going from sitting to reclining takes too much time to worry with. It would be easier to have two such tables and switch between the two, which defeats the whole purpose of the adjustability.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Beard

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Alienware Laptop 17 R5 with some silght modifications.
customer_reviews.text: For me, this aluminum portable table turn out to work just find for my huge Alienware 17 R5 Laptop. I just needed to extend the back out a few inches to keep my laptop from sliding off. Luckily the mouse pad was perfect for this. So I secured the mouse pad to the rear of the table with two screws, thus preventing this humongous Laptop from ever sliding off. I also added some black tape to the rear and front of this metal table to minimize scratching to my Laptop. I use this table daily now, with no complaints. Once I found the perfect leg position this table is now my favorite setup.
customer_reviews.author: DVC

customer_reviews.title: Great but hard to set up
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept and the usefulness once you have it set up. But I think maybe the designers decided to design something that could drive two reasonably sane people insane in less than 10 minutes. But all of that being said I do like it.
customer_reviews.author: CC Rider

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed but it works
customer_reviews.text: Received product and noticed it was lightweight so my concern was is it going to hold my laptop. It took awhile to adjust to my liking but after playing with it for sometime finally got used of it. Instructions not very user friendly. Use it sometimes and it works well in bed. I wish the incline was higher but still have room underneath. Would I recommend? For the price and value, probably but I would check other products and reviews before purchasing. This will make due for now.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Great product, adjusts easily, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am a student and do a lot of textbook reading and typing/reading on my laptop. My neck gets very sore and tight from looking down for hours. This product is a lifesaver! I love that it can be adjusted in so many ways and then folds flat to put away. I read reviews for similar products needing a tool to adjust the legs which deterred me. The adjustment with this stand is so easy and the product comes with good instructions for adjusting to 10 different positions. It is exactly what I was looking for and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: KatLV

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I do like this stand a lot, but it did take some getting use to. Once I got it adjusted just right, I haven’t moved it since. Great for working on a bed, or in a chair if the seat is long enough. The one thing I had to alter was the mouse stand. It’s extremely slick so I bought a $1 mouse pad and cut it to the size of the metal part and glued it on now it’s perfect. Others than that, I love this table a lot and I’m very happy with his purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bekah

customer_reviews.title: Cannot live without now!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I have found to enable me to hold my laptop and cool it at the same time. It fits in my recliner and holds computer at exactly the level and angle that I require!! Wish I had discovered this years ago!! Highly recommend --especially if you are an elder citizen who need the assistance!! That in no way means that it is not suitable for any age that can sit up!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cannot live without

customer_reviews.title: Well designed.
customer_reviews.text: Very clever and extremely well made for the price. Comes with a set of visual instructions for configuring the desk for various functions. This model has a tray that clips on the side that orients independently of the disk, so you can have the work surface at an angle - say to read - and the tray can be parallel to the floor. Although it isn't sturdy enough to be a drink holder, still dang useful for a mouse or cellphone, and shows "useful innovation" in a product that is intended to be useful as well as functional. The designers put some thought in on this one.
customer_reviews.author: G. L. Hester

customer_reviews.title: I feel stupid for believing...
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine but I feel stupid because in watching the video on Amazon's info page for this product, it appeared to me that one push of the button would raise the legs incrementally with each push. Now that I have the desk and see how it works, I am embarrassed to myself that I could be so gullible. I could've purchased a similar item for ten bucks. If the video was not somewhat deceptive, I would give this 5 stars as far as quality and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Beezus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: It was not clear to me how this was going to work. But I have been practicing things before my surgery and I can't believe how well it works. And the adjustable things have numbers on them so that you can just apply the same number on the other side without futzing with it. And then I suppose you can simply write down the different dimensions for different situations: bed, one setting; sitting in a chair, another. Etc. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa A. Baird

customer_reviews.title: maybe it's just me but...
customer_reviews.text: i couldn't figure out how to get this dang thing to work! adjusting it is a major pain, it fell over at every angle from being too top heavy. i never even tried to put my mac on it. i could see it crashing to the ground in an instant. nope, no thanks. i'll just use my lap. more trouble than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop stand
customer_reviews.text: I needed a stand to use my laptop while sitting on the couch. This is a very comfortable stand that can be adjusted to your preference at any time. I like that the buttons on the arms have/show the degree of the angle it is set to so next time you don’t have to be guessing again how to set it the same way. So far I’m pleased with the purchase. It’s light and sturdy as long as the angles on the legs are set properly. I also appreciate the fan that sits under the table of the stand keeping my laptop’s temperature in check. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: My chiropractor advised me to stop looking down as frequently as I do. I bought this to level out my viewing of my laptop ( I also bought a wireless keyboard that I place under the desk). So far so good, but I have two design complaints. 1. The lip needs to be bigger. When I place my laptop on the desk at a slight angle, it can slide off with a little pressure applied. I do have a older and thicker laptop, so that may be the reason. 2. I wish the ends of the legs had more gripping action.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great portable laptop desk! Sturdy, easy, and great if you're stuck in bed a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes need to work from home due to a chronic pain issue, and this thing is amazing for helping me to work and lay in bed at the same time. I love that each joint at the legs locks in at defined degrees, making it a breeze to ensure you are even on both sides. I feel sturdy and secure. I also use this as at Sit to Stand for the laptop at my desk so I can stand and work when that's more comfortable. For the price, I am definitely loving my choice. It has enabled me to be more functional despite my limitations physically with my condition. Wonderful choice
customer_reviews.author: Berta

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Portable Desk
customer_reviews.text: As the COVID hit and switched from office to working from home more permanently..I realized that I was hunched over while trying to do work most of the day! I wanted an accessory that was portable and had the ability for adjustments! I would recommend...you look at dimensions—Cuz if you a ‘lil fluffy‘ and have wide hips...not gonna fit around them comfortably!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Ugly but useful
customer_reviews.text: The good is that this adjustable laptop stand does what it says, is lightweight, sturdy, and pretty easy to use. The bad is that it's ugly. It looks awful sitting on my desk, and is rather big to easily stow away. I will keep looking for the ideal adjustable riser for switching my home office work area between sitting and standing height.
customer_reviews.author: FabFitFree

customer_reviews.title: My 17 inch laptop fit PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I've made on Amazon. The cooling fan is almost totally silent and it keeps my laptop perfectly cool (I have an HP Envy 17t that is prone to overheating) and the desk isn't flimsy in the slightest. The legs are strong as well as easy to adjust. I adore this desk. I can already tell that it has added years onto my beloved laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Tera

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little table is the freakin bomb! I love love love it. Very versatile, very light-weight, very sturdy and very handy for a multitude of uses. I was shocked at how well made this is. Bought it to hold my cross-stitch patterns and found uses for it for other things (like reading in bed). Would be a great gift for a college student who likes to study on their bed. It will raise up to use like an easel or go flat like a table and all degrees inbetween. I took it to work and everyone I showed it too was equally impressed. If you order this table, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: esb

customer_reviews.title: Lacking in STABILITY and STURDINESS
customer_reviews.text: This thing SLIPPED right off the wooden table it was on. I found it difficult to find a suitable position that it balanced and it was how I wanted it- so, I wish I would have gotten one that had a sturdiness and balanced. it was also wide. It wouldn't even work on a TV tray. I wish I would have gotten one that had a middle that was not too wide and it didn't feel like an experiment in engineering to try and get this thing not to tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a laptop table that I could use in whatever chair I was sitting in. This wasn't it because it just doesn't extend to a good height for that. However, once I tried all the different positions available, I loved it! I can take it anywhere because it weighs almost nothing, it fits in all my chairs (width-wise). The best part are the fans - my legs don't get tired OR hot! So yes, I'm glad I bought it. I will use it a lot - and not just for my computer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I did not use this until my return window had closed because I realized that mine is defective. The picture I included is when all angles match but clearly it is not even.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Vera

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand. I didn't want a whole standing desk only a stand like this that I can move around. It holds my laptop with no problem and I can move it from the Dining Room table to the kitchen and work while I do other things. It's sturdy enough and doesn't wobble or anything on me. I've also sat on the couch and used it in my lap as well. My back hurts and I have to work standing up sometimes, but not for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget A.

customer_reviews.title: This is a good idea
customer_reviews.text: A laptop "desk" that folds up, but does not let your laptop slide away like most devices like this that have a pillow or "bean bag" on the bottem that will not stay quite right. Another ides that I have not tried yet is to make a regular desk as a standup desk for a laptop. The mouse pad area I think could lbe a little larger, depending on how sensitive you have an external mouse set up. One caveat is that if you have big legs, you will not get it to sit outside of both legs since it was not made that wide.
customer_reviews.author: David Black

customer_reviews.title: Find the right balance and its very stable! No worries!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of how to move each joint you can easily find a configuration that will work for just about any thing you need. Mine doubles as my regular lap top desk and TV stand. Since we gave up cable and TV a few years ago and don't watch much, its usually laying in bed so this works great. Balance vs stability of the surface its on is the key. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Portable Laptop Stand Review
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little portable laptop stand....I just love it. Have health problems & need to lie down a lot but with this little stand I can keep working on my computer and not feel any uncomfortable weight on my legs. One will need to be a bit careful as the legs can't be made all that strong and still be as adjustable & flexible as they are but if one is fairly careful, there isn't any reason it shouldn't last for a long time. Over all am quite pleased with this purchase and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: marrene2

customer_reviews.title: Too confusing
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I am just blonde or dumb but I struggled too much to figure this out and by the time I was able to try it I was outside my return window. The mouse holder also kept falling off/out, that was also frustrating. I was so frustrated by the time I got this to work for me I was ready to box it up and just return it. I didn’t want to go through all that just to use it each time.
customer_reviews.author: Cedarrose1

customer_reviews.title: The different angles and the fact cooling fans were includeed into the design
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to explain I have a newer Macbook pro there are no Usb ports on my Computer, maybe the older ones have them but mine doesn't so the connection cord does not work? Seems the answers do not comprehend that mine is a 2018 and Apple eliminated the USB ports :( So please some one out there that understands this do I need an adapter and if so What Types of USB fitting this one is when I went online on Amazon there are at least 3 differrent types of USB??? Help please
customer_reviews.author: G. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: This surprised me!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about the legs of this laptop stand when I first opened the box and was playing with it. However, as I sit here typing this out while sitting in the lazyboy recliner, I'm impressed. The legs can be adjusted independently of one another, each leg in 3 different locations. I've set this up on my kitchen table to make my laptop stand-up height, on the couch and recliner to work with my foot elevated due to surgery, and next to the tub to relax in a bath with a faux fireplace. I'm impressed. Especially considering how inexpensive it was!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Topples over as the top is too heavy for the legs
customer_reviews.text: Not so good. It took me forever to figure out the many configurations. I had to use my magnifying glass to see the numbers to set the legs and it's very top heavy so no matter what position the legs are in, it topples over. The company was very nice and suggested I send it back which I did. They need to work on this some more before it's perfected. Nice idea though, too bad it didn't work. It's very time consuming to configure and then when you finally get it all worked out, it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Kate KenworthyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would work for me and I was a little worried reading some of the poor reviews. I got it set up to what I wanted and this thing is just works out just fine. It's not difficult to get it set up and it's sturdy enough to handle my laptop while I sit on the recliner. The legs are plastic but they seem fine to me and makes it light enough that I can lift it with just hand.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: It's okay -
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17" laptop and it barely fits on the table top area. Is easy to adjust but takes a bit to get it set up exactly. The mouse tray is absolutely useless - flimsy with small work area (right now I am using the arm of my chair - yes really). It is much smaller overall than I expected but it holds my 18 pound gaming computer with no difficulty. The fans work great
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Green

customer_reviews.title: I found it to be very useful, and the ability to maneuver it to different ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to work from a recliner while recovering from surgery. I found it to be very useful, and the ability to maneuver it to different angles was very helpful. It's very portable, easy to adjust and holds the laptop well. One option I would recommend on the mouse stand would be to put a non-skid and possibly ergonomic surface on it. When I would go from using the mouse to the keyboard, the mouse would slide off of the stand. I would recommend this for versatile, portable use of a laptop anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Golfygirl

customer_reviews.title: Very effective, well designed
customer_reviews.text: This really helps me keep my large, heavy laptop at a comfortable height above my lap as I type from my lounge chair - much better than having the laptop directly on my lap. I bought this to help me get more in the mood to write (from a comfortable, relaxed sofa) vs. having to sit at a desk, which makes the writing feel more like work for me. I really like this and it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: John McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Best lap desk I've ever bought, & I've tried a LOT of them!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize when I purchased this that it had a built-in dual fan system for keeping my laptop cool, so that was just a bonus! It's powered off of a USB port on my laptop and the cord doesn't get in the way. So far, no more overheating issues. That's a big plus. Also, this lap desk is STABLE! I am so very grateful for that! I have a memory foam mattress and every other style I've tried was unstable and tipped over easily. This one stays where I put it! I love this desk!
customer_reviews.author: Cynderella

customer_reviews.title: Gives you the option to stand up at work throughout the day
customer_reviews.text: I don't use a monitor at work, but wanted to be able to stand for an hour or so every couple of hours. The stand and mouse pad is just the right amount of solution for the problem. It's lightweight, easy to click into the desired configuration, and when I'm ready to sit back down, I just push it to the back of my cubicle, grab the laptop & mouse, and switch to sitting. Really happy with this product so far. I do see the potential for the mouse pad starting to angle downward over time with use, given that you're putting some weight on it; perhaps there's a way to mitigate that.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Fits into my recliner seat and still goes over my legs!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a laptop and want to use it while in my recliner. Product description states will fit into a chair, so took a leap of faith and decided to give it a try. The fit is perfect! I love the cooling fan. Unit is easy to adjust, and even though light-weight I think it will hold up. My only wish would be for greater flexibility on the placement for the mouse tray. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: M Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand
customer_reviews.text: Very adjustable and comfortable. Very well made and the adjustment has a very positive click and is infinitely adjustable. There is a lip that stops your laptop from sliding down when the angle of adjustment is high. The built-in cooling fans also do a great job and you can switch them off without unplugging the usb power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Fourie

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: I liked this desk, it was immediately adaptable to my recliner. I also liked the cooling fan that keeps the laptop battery cooler. HOWEVER, this team broke after 3 weeks of use in a recliner... one of the legs snapped off. I reported it to the company.. and was assured they would give my money back. That did NOT happen! The company promised a refund... I never saw it.
customer_reviews.author: scarredpoet45

customer_reviews.title: Both fans broke
customer_reviews.text: I don't like writing bad reviews - but within a year of getting this product both fans stopped working and I had to replace the cord going from the computer to the desk. When I contacted customer service they pointed me towards where I could replace the fan and the cord. That didn't help. Now I have a product that I cannot use. Would have be a lot better if their customer service worked with me.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: A little awkward but so nice.
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot, it's a nail breaker to adjust but very useful once I got it right. When it's adjusted right for my chair, it's configured in such a way that it won't stand up on the floor when I get up. It sprawls on its back with legs sticking up. I'm not willing to fold it up. Will work on a stand to hold it when I'm not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is totally portable & flexible and really like it!
customer_reviews.text: The best portable lap top stand I have ever had. Fits my laptop on my recliner chair/couch comfortably. I like how I can position it several ways and I haven't had the need to use the fans to keep my laptop cool. I have been finding myself bringing this laptop stand around the house with me to use for almost anything I need a table top for in a pinch. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: BDeveroux

customer_reviews.title: Better than your lap.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who has severe back problems. After his surgery I first bought a hospital table that titled and let's say I wasted money. I saw this item and thought perfect he can set lay stand travel he can do every position he needed. But gosh it looks very complicated. Well when it arrived I was sent an email with instructions more contact information if I needed it for help on setting it up. My husband had it together in less than thirty minutes. He absolutely loves it. It's the best thing you will ever buy and this company doesn't leave you hanging after they've made a sell. They keep in contact and that's impressive. Kudos
customer_reviews.author: Dianna D.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: EMBARASSING! I bought this for my husband, Walter York! Disappointed and embarrassed now I wish I never ordered it! Lightweight never even got to use it! Upon removing it from the box I pushed in a button to rotate the leg to a proper position the button went in but will not come out making that leg totally useless! Had it have work this would’ve been a great solution to my husbands working on paperwork from his easy chair in the evenings.
customer_reviews.author: Dee York

customer_reviews.title: Good experience with my new York Desk
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for about a week. I like the freedom of using a laptop in my lap - - whether it is on the sofa or in an easy chair. Within a day my neck started feeling better from looking straight at the screen instead of looking down into it. Ergonomics at the wrist are better too because of the tilted tabletop that aligns with my forearms. Seems very sturdy too. In all, I couldn't be happier with the York desk.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Total Comfort with Desktop or iPad - love love love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Desk York adjustable lap desk and the larger one with the mouse pad. They have solved a huge problem for me! I currently have a pinched nerve in my neck and it was very painful to work on my iPad and my desktop PC. The littler one I can set up for working on my iPad with comfort. The larger one with the mouse pad...solved a huge issue by allowing me to set up my Desktop as a standing desk. Much healthier way to work than sitting at a desk most of the day!!! They were easy to configure for both purposes. Love Love Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl  in SoCal

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It was relatively easy to set up and very stable. I think the people who have complained that it tips over easily have just not figured out the right way to set the legs. It is currently set up for me to work in my bed, and it's perfect. I'll be honest, I haven't messed with the configuration since finding the right one for my use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Bad cable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stand to make my viewing position more comfortable while using the computer in my recliner chair. It is very adjustable and has worked very well in terms of being stable and adjusting to a good position. However, within a month or so, the cable connector for the fan broke. I woulds have given a higher rating if the cable was better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bigs1

customer_reviews.title: Using it right now!
customer_reviews.text: Deliberated between quite a few postings with similar product. Took a chance on this one. So far, so good. Setting a 15in macbook pro is steady enough to type on while i'm laying down on the bed with my head elevated by 2 pillows. I'm content at being able to compute laying down.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use adjust
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to adjust, have to press in very hard in some the buttons WHILE adjusting position and difficult to get in equal balance. Might be good for someone who sets to one position and doesn’t move from there but that wasn’t the case for me. Too difficult and awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: KarenSuperMom

customer_reviews.title: I have now found the perfect laptop desk
customer_reviews.text: For 1/4 the price of similar items advertised on Facebook, I have now found the perfect laptop desk. Very easy to find the perfect positioning for chair, desk, or bedtime laptop use or reading. I often need to stand at work at times to relieve a neck issue and this desk will enable me to keep on working. I really couldn't be happier. It's vey well made. The fan that connects to the laptop through a USB port is so silent I din't think it was on. So... you'll see many advertised but I can't imagine a better price or a better company to buy this from.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. VII

customer_reviews.title: Great as a standing desk on top of my work dest.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on my desk in my home office so I can stand some while working. It works fine for that. It is also fine for a desk in the bed. It adjusts infinitely and I got it to work as a lap desk in my recliner but it was a bit of a hassle. I use the mouse pad attachment all of the time which is handy. You don't want to bear down on it at all but for normal use it is sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Averie Nash

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my laptop. I'm really impressed by the design of this desk, very easy to adjust to whatever position I fancy by simply changing the angles at the knots. My sincere congratulations and gratitude to the company for making this product!
customer_reviews.author: CSD

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient, Not Practical!
customer_reviews.text: Poor instruction, no instructions to attach mouse pad, parts for that didn't fit at all. To change position you have to take your stuff off , lay it upside down and adjust each leg independently, which is a real pain, to me. I'm keeping it, but if I knew what I know now, I would not have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: M Derr

customer_reviews.title: Useful and reliable product
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great product that does what I need it to do. My main purpose in buying this was to have my laptop higher on my desk and to have something that I could use on my lap in bed or on the couch. It does both beautifully. The multiple available levels is a nice feature but I don’t change the levels much because it isn’t easy to move it up and down - if it were easier then it wouldn’t be as sturdy in my opinion. The built in fans are a nice feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Lyn Marsch

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: The legs of the product are made with some kind of plastic but it's actually sturdier than I thought it was going to be. The tabletop where you set your computer is made of even sturdier material. The fan works great at keeping my laptops cool. It's also wide enough for me to sit in between the legs. It does get a little tedious trying to change the angles on the legs since you have to change part one by one. But it's really useful for someone who uses their computer sitting, standing, or laying down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I like the stand but had a difficult time getting it adjusted to sit level on my couch. Every time I put my laptop on it, it tipped forward. I may use it from time to time but I probably wouldn't buy it again. However, my daughter has the exact stand and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra P.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but a flaw in the mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this part desk for a few days and like it so far. It has a lot of adjustment to fit what ever situation you are in. The down side is one of the buttons for the adjustment of the leg sticks. I had to take it apart in order to get it to release. The button still sticks in occasion If I had not been able to get it to release the desk would have been useless.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Table top or lap desk eases back strain
customer_reviews.text: The desk works pretty well although in some configurations it can not stand alone. Nevertheless, it is lightweight and functions both as a lap desk and a standing desk that can be used on a table top. As someone with serious back problems, it greatly minimizes discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!
